titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Helen Edna Buck Letter
1916 September 30
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Teresa Hamann

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Teresa Hamann 2011

change.item: Biographical information for Helen Edna Buck was updated and additional information about the contents of the letter was added to the finding aid.

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection consists of a photocopy of Helen Edna Buck's thirty-two page, handwritten letter from September 30, 1916 detailing her family's move from Yakima, Washington, to Rhodes, Iowa, driving through Idaho, Yellowstone Park, Montana, the Dakotas, and Minnesota.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Helen Edna Buck was born in Wilton, Iowa in 1884 to Henry G. and Phoebe Parker Buck. The letter in this collection documents her move from Yakima, Washington to Rhodes, Iowa, with her parents in 1916. Buck and her family drove through Idaho, Yellowstone Park, Montana, the Dakotas, and Minnesota. She died in Marshalltown, Iowa on May 15, 1945.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes a photocopy of Helen Edna Buck's thirty-two page, handwritten letter to Clara Ballard (addressed as Dear Friend) detailing her family's move from Yakima, Washington to Rhodes, Iowa. Buck describes the weather, roads, camp sites and camping conditions, livestock and wildlife encounters, interesting geology, towns and people they encountered. The towns in Montana included Saltese, St. Regis, Huson, Missoula, Butte, Whitehall, Custer, Miles City, Glendive, and Wibaux. Their route included the road called the Camel's Hump. She also writes of going through Yellowstone Park, car trouble, and how she felt about her new home.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright not transferred to The University of Montana-Missoula

prefercite.p: Helen Edna Buck Letter, Archives and Special Collections, Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula.

acqinfo.p: Professor William Ballard and his wife Lee Ballard loaned this letter for duplication in May 1979.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
